title: Some still trying to find a home
subtitle: Some still trying to find a home
body: The offseason's premier free agent has finally found a home, Theo Epstein having rejoined the Red Sox as The Executive to be Named Later.  So now we can turn our attention to other luminaries remaining on the market. With nary a month to go before pitchers and catchers and trainers report, ample big names are still looking for their next marquee.  As of Friday morning, a total of 118 free agents had signed, either with their old clubs or new ones. Yet several high-profile guys are still knocking on doors. Â• 5. Frank Thomas, first base (White Sox) Can Big Hurt stop living up to his nickname? Obviously, that's the leading question among teams interested in picking up a 37-year-old who can still hit when he can stand.         Tom Singer is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Tom Singer
